english: beautiful; graceful lady; female given name

etymology.description: 丽(beautiful) + 媛(graceful lady) = graceful, beautiful lady; used as a female given name.
etymology.interpretation: Combines two feminine morphemes to emphasize beauty and grace, projecting an elegant, cultured image. Common as a female given name in modern Chinese.
etymology.simplification: 麗 was simplified to 丽 to reduce strokes and regularize the graph; 媛 was unchanged. Thus 麗媛 → 丽媛.

examples.chinese: 她叫丽媛(她叫麗媛)，名字很优雅(名字很優雅)。
examples.pinyin: Tā jiào Lìyuán, míngzi hěn yōuyǎ.
examples.english: She is named Liyuan, and the name sounds elegant.

examples.chinese: 父母取名丽媛(父母取名麗媛)，寄望孩子美丽端庄(寄望孩子美麗端莊)。
examples.pinyin: Fùmǔ qǔmíng Lìyuán, jìwàng háizi měilì duānzhuāng.
examples.english: The parents chose the name Liyuan, hoping the child will be beautiful and dignified.

examples.chinese: 诗文里“媛”常指美貌女子(詩文裡「媛」常指美貌女子)，与“丽”相呼应(與「麗」相呼應)。
examples.pinyin: Shīwén lǐ “yuán” cháng zhǐ měimào nǚzǐ, yǔ “lì” xiāng húyìng.
examples.english: In literary texts, "yuán" often refers to a beautiful woman, echoing the sense of "lì."
